text: Pyrausta corinthalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by William Barnes and James Halliday McDunnough in 1914. It is found in Mexico and the United States, where it has been recorded from California and Arizona. The wingspan is 16–18 mm. The basal half of the forewings is olive brown and the outer half is rose pink with an oblique white subterminal band parallel to the outer margin. Adults have been recorded on wing in April, June and from September to October. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1914 corinthalis Category:Moths of North America
title: Pyrausta corinthalis
